content:
Despite their young age, Emily and Sarah took their responsibilities as caregivers for Lucy very seriously. They knew that their sister was unable to move or care for herself, so they worked hard to make sure that she had everything she needed to be comfortable and happy.

One of the first things they did was to create a special area for Lucy to live in. They set up a large, padded mat on the floor, and covered it with blankets and pillows to make it as comfortable as possible. They also made sure that Lucy had access to all of her favorite toys and books, so that she could stay entertained and engaged.

To help Lucy with her daily needs, Emily and Sarah developed a routine that included regular feedings and diaper changes, as well as regular check-ins to make sure that she was comfortable and happy. They also made sure that Lucy had plenty of opportunity to socialize and interact with others, including their parents and friends.

In addition to these practical tasks, Emily and Sarah also made sure to spend plenty of quality time with Lucy, playing games and reading stories with her, and just generally enjoying each other's company. They knew that their sister's situation was difficult, and they did everything they could to make her feel loved and supported.

Overall, Emily and Sarah were dedicated and loving caregivers for Lucy, and they did everything they could to make sure that she had the best possible quality of life despite her challenging circumstances.
